footer.thank_me: Appreciate the project? Support me on Ko-fi!
footer.line_2: WC 2026 POOL is an independent, non-commercial website intended for participants in a football pool during the FIFA World Cup 2026. This website is solely for entertainment purposes and allows users to track their predictions and scores throughout the tournament.

home.match_schedule_title: View the World Cup 2026 match schedule
home.match_schedule_text: Check out the match schedule for the tournament in Canada, Mexico and USA with each of the 104 fixtures from the 48-team event.

ranking.ranking_text: On this page, you can easily search for a team by typing its name in the search bar — the rankings will update automatically. Curious how things looked in an earlier round? Jump back in time to view the standings and score progress as they were then. Want to see someone’s exact predictions? Just click on the player’s name to view all of their predictions.
ranking.table_page: {count} result per page|{count} results per page

rules.text_1: You earn points by (partially) correctly predicting match results. In addition, you can earn bonus points by (partially) correctly predicting standings and/or statistics. Finally, there are additional points to be earned through the bonus questions.
rules.points_total: A total of {points} points can be earned.
rules.text_2: The maximum number of points you can earn per match is 10 points. A total of {matches} matches will be played during the tournament. You can earn up to {matchPoints} points from match predictions.
rules.points1: 10 pts for a fully correct match prediction.
rules.points2: 7 pts for a correctly predicted draw with an incorrect final score.
rules.points3: 5 pts for a correctly predicted winner with an incorrect final score.
rules.points4: 2 pts for a correctly predicted score for one of the teams.
rules.result_help: *The result refers to the score after 90 minutes.
rules.knockout_text: For each correctly predicted team in the knockout stage, points can be earned.
rules.knockout1: 5 pts per team in round of 32.
rules.knockout2: 10 pts per team in round of 16.
rules.knockout3: 20 pts per team in quarter-finals.
rules.knockout4: 30 pts per team in semi-finals.
rules.knockout5: 50 pts per team in finals.
rules.bonus_text: For questions where a team or player must be provided, you can earn 10 pts. For estimation questions the points are awarded as follows:
rules.bonus1: 40 pts when the number is predicted exactly.
rules.bonus2: 25 pts when the predicted number is off by a maximum of 5.
rules.bonus3: 15 pts when the predicted number is off by a maximum of 10.
rules.prize_text: Each participant pays €11, of which €10 goes directly into the prize pool and €1 is allocated for administrative costs. The more participants, the larger the prize pool! The exact contents of the prize pool will be announced once registrations have closed.
rules.info2: Team predicted incorrectly, but in knock-out.

step1.title: Team name
step1.sub_title: Sign up for the pool now!
step1.p1: Enter your details below to participate in this exciting football pool for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.
step1.p2: The tournament will be bigger than ever: with {countries} participating countries and no less than {matches} matches, it will be a World Cup not to miss. The matches will take place in the United States, Mexico, and Canada, spread across multiple host cities.
step1.p3: During the tournament, you can earn points by correctly (or partially) predicting match results. Additionally, you can earn bonus points for predicting rankings, statistics, and bonus questions. The better your predictions, the higher you'll rank on the leaderboard!
step1.p4: Want to know more about the scoring system and the rules? See:
step1.p5: Good luck – and have fun predicting!
step1.name: Your name

step2.title: Group stage
step2.p1: In the group stage of the 2026 World Cup, 48 countries compete in 12 groups of 4 teams each. For every match in the group stage, you must submit a prediction. Think carefully about your guesses — each correct (or partially correct) answer earns points that count toward the overall ranking!

step3.title: Round of 32
step3.p1: Now fill in the knockout stage for the final 32 teams. To automatically populate the teams based on your predictions, click the ‘Auto-fill’ button. The group winners and the best third-placed teams will then be calculated based on your earlier predictions from step 2. You can still manually adjust the automatically filled teams if you wish. Make sure everything is correct before proceeding to the next round.
step3.p2: You predict the score after 90 minutes of play, so without extra time or penalty shootouts. In case of a draw, you can select which team you think will advance to the next round.

step4.title: Round of 16
step4.p1: Now fill in the knockout stage for the final 16 teams. To automatically populate the teams based on your previous predictions, click the ‘Auto-fill’ button. The teams will then be determined based on the results you entered in the first knockout round (last 32). You can still manually adjust the automatically filled teams if you wish. Make sure everything is correct before proceeding to the next round.

step5.title: Finals
step5.p1: Now fill in the final rounds: quarter-finals, semi-finals, and the final. To automatically populate the teams based on your predictions, click the ‘Auto-fill’ button. The teams will then be determined based on the results you entered in the previous round. You can still manually adjust the automatically filled teams if you wish. Make sure everything is correct before proceeding to the next round.

step6.title: Bonus questions
step6.p1: Besides predicting the matches, you can earn extra points with bonus questions. For questions where you need to name a team or player, a correct answer earns you 10 points. For estimation questions, you will receive 40 points for an exact prediction, 25 points if you are within five, and 15 points if you are within ten. A total of 215 points can be earned from the bonus questions. A strong score on these questions can ultimately make the difference in the rankings.
step6.p2: The answers you provide for the bonus questions do not need to match the predictions you previously made for the matches. This allows you to spread your chances and play more strategically.

step7.title: Submit
step7.p1: Follow the steps below to complete your entry. Carefully review your predictions, download your submission, and send it to the organization.

check.title: Check
check.p1: Carefully review all entered results and chosen finalists. Correct any mistakes before proceeding.
check.p2: Once submitted, no changes can be made.

download.title: Download your prediction sheet
download.p1: Click the download button to save your submission. This is a JSON file containing all the predictions and data you have filled in. Keep it safe.

mail.title: Email your sheet to the organization
mail.p1: Email the downloaded file to the organization. Please use our template for this by clicking the button below. Make sure you attach the downloaded JSON file.

confirm.title: Wait for confirmation
confirm.p1: After submission, you will receive a payment link from the organization. Once the payment is completed, your sheet will be added to the pool.

my_page.text: By telling the website who you are, you can create a personal shortcut. This shortcut gives you quick access to your own predictions page, making it easy to check what you’ve submitted.

faq.faq1: Until when can I change my predictions?
faq.ans1: You can update your entry form and submit it to the organizers until Friday, June 5, 2025.
faq.ans2: Match results are entered shortly after each game finishes. If that’s not possible, they’ll be updated no later than 12:00 PM the following day.
faq.faq3: When are the bonus question points awarded?
faq.ans3: Bonus question answers are processed after the group stage. Points are awarded as soon as answers are confirmed, although some won’t be finalized until the tournament concludes.
